item.title: By: barbara
item.dc:creator: barbara
item.description: <div class="comment_body"><div><p>Lovely profile, and lovely photo of the Angelus as well.  Thanks.</p><p> </p></div></div>
item.content:encoded: Lovely profile, and lovely photo of the Angelus as well.  Thanks.

item.title: By: kim
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: <div class="comment_body"><div><p>Thanks, Diarmid, for discovering and sharing Officer Matuskiwiz' amazing story. I'd love to share it, but how on earth do you pronounce that surname? Maybe Ma-TOO-ski-witz?</p></div></div>
item.content:encoded: Thanks, Diarmid, for discovering and sharing Officer Matuskiwiz’ amazing story. I’d love to share it, but how on earth do you pronounce that surname? Maybe Ma-TOO-ski-witz?

item.title: By: Diarmid Mogg
item.dc:creator: Diarmid Mogg
item.description: <div class="comment_body"><div><p>I'd guess it started out as "ma-tUHsk-evitch", back in the old country, before morphing to "ma-TOOsk-evitz" after emigration.</p><p>He might have had a son, as there's a mention of a train driver called William Matuskiwitz who was involved in saving an LA-bound train from crashing (he noticed flames coming from the engine or something) sometime in the 30s or 30s, and he might have had a wife called Daisy Ellen Matuskiwiz (nee McGee) who lived in California around the same time as Billy.</p><p>The Matuskiwiz trail goes cold there, though.</p><p> </p></div></div>
item.content:encoded:
I’d guess it started out as “ma-tUHsk-evitch”, back in the old country, before morphing to “ma-TOOsk-evitz” after emigration.

He might have had a son, as there’s a mention of a train driver called William Matuskiwitz who was involved in saving an LA-bound train from crashing (he noticed flames coming from the engine or something) sometime in the 30s or 30s, and he might have had a wife called Daisy Ellen Matuskiwiz (nee McGee) who lived in California around the same time as Billy.

The Matuskiwiz trail goes cold there, though.

item.title: By: kim
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: <div class="comment_body"><div><p>I found another possible connection in <a href="http://www.6579pickwickbiography.com/the-architect.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">this</a> reference to an "ornate Andalusian"-style home built in the Hollywood hills for someone by the surname. Google street view <a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=8801+Appian+Way,+los+angeles,+ca&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=31.839416,71.279297&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=8801+Appian+Way,+Los+Angeles,+California+90046&t=h&z=16&layer=c&cbll=34.105705,-118.381022&panoid=a2sQZOVFFNpQEq97s0PR9A&cbp=12,42.66,,0,2.34" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">shows</a> there is still quite a grand Spanish house on that site, assuming I'm looking at the right side of the street. So maybe Officer Billy's kids did okay for themselves.</p></div></div>
item.content:encoded: I found another possible connection in this reference to an “ornate Andalusian”-style home built in the Hollywood hills for someone by the surname. Google street view shows there is still quite a grand Spanish house on that site, assuming I’m looking at the right side of the street. So maybe Officer Billy’s kids did okay for themselves.

item.title: By: Diarmid Mogg
item.dc:creator: Diarmid Mogg
item.description: <div class="comment_body"><div><p>When that house was commissioned, our Matuskiwiz would just have finished 35 years on the force. I suppose it might have been his retirement gift to himself, if he'd saved REALLY hard...</p></div></div>
item.content:encoded: When that house was commissioned, our Matuskiwiz would just have finished 35 years on the force. I suppose it might have been his retirement gift to himself, if he’d saved REALLY hard…
